weather_report:
Subiaco slides into early afternoon under a softening sky, the morning’s brightness dimming as a grey veil gathers. Air feels mild and a touch humid, with a salt-and-eucalyptus tang on the breeze. Sunlight is filtered, more pearly than brilliant; the UV will sit in the moderate range around lunchtime, still enough to warrant a dab of sunscreen if you’re out, then easing as clouds thicken. Expect light rain to wander in through the afternoon and linger toward evening, the kind that dapples pavements and hushes the day. Visibility will be decent but muted, edges smudged, colours cooled.

Dress in light layers with a compact rain jacket or umbrella at hand, comfortable closed shoes, and a cap if you’re strolling now before the showers settle. It’s a good window for a coffee run, a quiet browse at the library, or a gentle loop around the neighborhood between sprinkles; later, errands close to home, a tidy of the balcony, or some unhurried kitchen prep fit the mood. The day isn’t harsh or hostile—just contemplative, inviting you to move a little slower and listen to the rain find its rhythm.
